description.narrative: By 2016, expanded coverage of child-sensitive social assistance for poor, ethnic minority, and other vulnerable children

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Vietnam Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

2018 Vietnam: External After Action Review of the Government of Viet Nam and UNICEF emergency response supporting children and women in 10 provinces in Viet Nam affected by drought and salt water intrusion crisis (2016-2017)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, expanded coverage of child-sensitive social assistance for poor, ethnic minority, and other vulnerable children

description.narrative: A gradual transition to universal child benefit packages for children from zero to three years of age was reflected in a government document, the Master Plan for Social Assistance Reform 2016-2030, and policymakers recognized the challenges in child poverty reduction and early childhood development, especially among ethnic minority children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Availability of an updated in-depth analysis of ethnic minority child poverty and vulnerability to inform follow-up inter-sectorial policy dialogue organised by Committee on Ethnic Minority Affairs (CEMA)

baseline.value: 2011 analysis available but no inter-sectorial follow up dialogue organised

target.value: 2014:Available and follow-up policy dialogue organised by CEMA

actual.value: 2014:The final draft report is available. It is expected to receive a final clearance of the counterpart. The report will be published by early 2015. Key results were discussed at high level policy fora on sustainable poverty reduction and EM policies, including an international conference on EM develop

title.narrative: Integration of a child sensitive approach into model for cash transfer to poor families with children and pregnant women in the MOLISA project on Social Assistance System Strengthening

baseline.value: Detailed Project Outline and WB Project Appraisal Document under development

target.value: 2013:Included in MOLISA project on social assistance system strengthening

actual.value: 2013:Completed. Child-sensitive approach was included into the design of the consolidated cash transfer to poor families with children under 16 years old. All key documents were adopted. Implementation start is planned for mid-2015.

title.narrative: Availability of policy options for Rapid Impact Monitoring (RIM) institutionalisation based on a comprehensive review of the lessons learnt from the RIM formulated by MOLISA

baseline.value: No policy option formulated by MOLISA

target.value: 2014:Policy options for RIM institutionalisation based on a comprehensive review of the lessons learnt from the RIM formulated by MOLISA

actual.value: 2014:Completed. Under RIM 4 in 2013, Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs/Institute for Labour Studies and other national partners have started an assessment of the options for the institutionalisation of RIM. They will be finalised at the end of 2014.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

actual.value: 2017:Decree 136 and related polices established to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

title.narrative: Integration of UNICEF and World Bank lessons learned from the MOLISA project on Social Assistance System Strengthening to inform MOLISA policy options for improved social assistance delivery

target.value: 2016:Integrated into MOLISA policy options submitted to the Government for improved social assistance systems
